description:
**Fix Overview**: 

To address the Windows Media Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2023-21740), multiple security updates have been released. To ensure your systems are protected, follow these steps:

1. Identify your Windows version and build number.
2. Apply the relevant security updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog based on your version:
   - For Windows 10, apply KB5033373 or KB5033379
   - For Windows 11, ensure KB5033375 is installed
   - For Windows Server 2016 or other impacted versions, download updates KB5033373, KB5033420, etc.
3. Restart your system to complete the installation of the updates.

**Details**: 
- These updates address vulnerabilities that could allow for remote code execution, ensuring improved security against potential exploits. 
- For downloading updates manually, access the Microsoft Update Catalog using the following links:
   - [KB5033375](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033375)
   - [KB5033373](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033373)
   - [KB5033379](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033379)
   - [KB5033369](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033369)
   - [KB5033420](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033420)

**Preconditions**: 
- Confirm that your system is not running in a restricted environment that might block updates.
- Backup important data prior to installation.
